abstract: Citigroup’s third-quarter earnings release managed to lift bank stocks on Monday.
snippet: Citigroup’s third-quarter earnings release managed to lift bank stocks on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Vikram Pandit, chief executive of Citigroup, has snatched some of Jamie Dimon’s market momentum. Mr. Dimon, who runs JPMorgan Chase, has lately been setting a comforting tone for the sector’s earnings. But growing foreclosure-related fears overshadowed his bank’s latest decent results. Now, his counterpart at Citigroup seems to be the one reassuring investors.

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE, JOHN FOLEY  and UNA GALANI

abstract: In an interview with Fortune, the outspoken chief executive of JPMorgan Chase again emphasizes that his firm can manage Washington’s new rules for the financial industry.
snippet: In an interview with Fortune, the outspoken chief executive of JPMorgan Chase again emphasizes that his firm can manage Washington’s new rules for the financial industry.
lead_paragraph: Few banking executives have been more vocal about the financial regulatory overhaul — and what should and shouldn’t be included — than Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase. And in an interview with Fortune’s Duff McDonald, the outspoken Mr. Dimon again emphasizes that his firm can manage Washington’s new rules for the financial industry.

headline.main: Dimon on Regulation: We Can Handle It

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
